meanings.definition: The act of renouncing or rejecting something.
meanings.sent1: Her abnegation of dessert showed her commitment to her diet.
meanings.sent2: His abnegation of the offer surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: In a moment of abnegation, she gave up her seat on the bus for an elderly lady.
meanings.sent4: The abnegation of his former beliefs opened up new possibilities for him.
meanings.sent5: The monk's abnegation of worldly possessions was truly inspiring.

meanings.sent1: The soldier's abnegation saved his comrades in battle.
meanings.sent2: Her abnegation of personal comfort for the sake of others was admirable.
meanings.sent3: His abnegation of the last piece of cake made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The abnegation of sleep for the sake of work took a toll on his health.
meanings.sent5: The abnegation of his own desires for the greater good was a true act of heroism.
